stem: A 32-year-old client with bipolar disorder is admitted after his Sertraline (SSRI) dose was doubled while he was taking Lihtium. Based on the documentation in the Critical Psych-Neuro & Serotonin Surveillance Log tab, complete the bowtie by selecting the most likely condition, the two actions the nurse should take, and the two parameters the nurse should monitor.

tabs.title: SBAR
tabs.content:
Situation: Acute CNS irritability and autonomic storm.
Background: Stable on Lithium. New increase in Sertraline 200mg.
Assessment: Client is sweaty, agitated, and his legs are 'jerking uncontrollably.' BP 182/104.
Recommendation: Immediate stop of all serotonergic agents.

actionOptions.text: Administer IV Benzodiazepines (e.g., Diazepam) to control rigidity
Instruct the client to perform heavy muscle exercises to stop the clonus
Administer STAT PO Lithium to calm the patient down

parameterOptions.text: Core temperature and presence of Inducible Clonus
Neurological status and Heart rate (Autonomic stability)
Daily measurement of fasting serum glucose
Presence of a positive Babinski sign

rationale.correct: This is Serotonin Syndrome (c2). Lithium acts as a powerful potentiator of serotonin. When combined with a high-dose SSRI (Sertraline), it can trigger a life-threatening autonomic crisis. The cues are the 'Hyper' symptoms: Hyperreflexia, Clonus, Hyperthermia (103.2), and Mydriasis. Priority actions are stopping the drugs (a1) and using Benzos (a2) to cool the body and relax the muscles. Monitoring focuses on the Temp/Clonus (p1) and autonomic stability (p2).
clinicalPearls: Serotonin syndrome is characterized by HYPER-reflexia and clonus (shaking legs).
Neuroleptic Malignant Syndrome (NMS) is the 'Look-alike' but it features 'Lead-Pipe' rigidity (NO clonus).
Cyproheptadine is the specific antidote for Serotonin Syndrome if benzos fail.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: If the Lithium level is 1.4 (Therapeutic-High) but the patient is in a full storm with 103 fever and jerking legs, it’s not just the Lithium; it’s an interaction. Check the SSRI!

mnemonic.title: S-H-I-V-E-R
mnemonic.expansion: S-Sweating. H-Hyperreflexia/Clonus. I-Increased Temp. V-Vital sign instability. E-Encephalopathy. R-Restless.
